elements.description:
The overlay element.

### Styling

See [`<vaadin-overlay>` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html)
for `<vaadin-dropdown-menu-overlay>` parts.

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: _last
properties.description: returns true if this is the last one in the opened overlays stack

properties.name: owner
properties.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the overlay.
Receives arguments `root`, `owner`, `model`

`root` The root container element. Users are able to append content to it.

`owner` The host element of the renderer function.

`model` Object with properties that could be required during the rendering process.

**NOTE:** The renderer callback can be called several times with previous content available

properties.name: template
properties.description: The template of the overlay content.

properties.name: instanceProps
properties.description: Optional argument for `Polymer.Templatize.templatize`.

properties.name: content
properties.description: References the content container after the template is stamped.

properties.name: model
properties.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

properties.name: modeless
properties.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

properties.name: focusTrap
properties.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

methods.name: _outsideClickListener
methods.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

elements.name: Vaadin.DropdownMenuOverlayElement

attributes.name: owner
attributes.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the overlay.
Receives arguments `root`, `owner`, `model`

`root` The root container element. Users are able to append content to it.

`owner` The host element of the renderer function.

`model` Object with properties that could be required during the rendering process.

**NOTE:** The renderer callback can be called several times with previous content available

attributes.name: template
attributes.description: The template of the overlay content.

attributes.name: instance-props
attributes.description: Optional argument for `Polymer.Templatize.templatize`.

attributes.name: content
attributes.description: References the content container after the template is stamped.

attributes.name: model
attributes.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

attributes.name: modeless
attributes.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

attributes.name: focus-trap
attributes.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-close
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-close
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-escape-press
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-escape-press
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on ESC button press. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-open
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-open
fired after the `vaadin-overlay` is opened.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-outside-click
events.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

elements.description:
The text-field element.

### Styling

See [`<vaadin-text-field>` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-text-field/blob/master/src/vaadin-text-field.html)
for `<vaadin-dropdown-menu-text-field>` parts and available slots (prefix, suffix etc.)

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

properties.name: _previousTabIndex
properties.description: Stores the previous value of tabindex attribute of the disabled element

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description:
Whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.
List of available options at:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#attr-autocomplete

properties.name: autocorrect
properties.description:
This is a property supported by Safari that is used to control whether
autocorrection should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text.
Possible values are:
on: Enable autocorrection.
off: Disable autocorrection.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.description:
This is a property supported by Safari and Chrome that is used to control whether
autocapitalization should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text.
Possible values are:
characters: Characters capitalization.
words: Words capitalization.
sentences: Sentences capitalization.
none: No capitalization.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: Error to show when the input value is invalid.

properties.name: label
properties.description: String used for the label element.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: Maximum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: Minimum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: This attribute indicates that the user cannot modify the value of the control.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Specifies that the user must fill in a value.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The initial value of the control.
It can be used for two-way data binding.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: This property is set to true when the control value is invalid.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.description:
When set to true, user is prevented from typing a value that
conflicts with the given `pattern`.

properties.name: list
properties.description:
Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.
The value must be the id of a <datalist> element in the same document.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description:
A regular expression that the value is checked against.
The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Message to show to the user when validation fails.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Moving the focus from the host element causes firing of the blur event what leads to problems in IE.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Native bluring in the host element does nothing because it does not have the focus.
In chrome it works, but not in FF.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description: Returns true if the current input value satisfies all constraints (if any)

methods.name: validate
methods.description:
Returns true if `value` is valid.
`<iron-form>` uses this to check the validity or all its elements.

return.desc: True if the value is valid.

events.description: Fired when the user commits a value change.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-dropdown-menu>` is a Polymer 2 element for selecting values from a list of items.

```
<vaadin-dropdown-menu>
  <template>
    <vaadin-list-box>
      <vaadin-item label="foo">Foo</vaadin-item>
      <vaadin-item>Bar</vaadin-item>
      <vaadin-item>Baz</vaadin-item>
    </vaadin-list-box>
  </template>
</vaadin-dropdown-menu>
```

Hint: By setting the `label` property of inner vaadin-items you will
be able to change the visual representation of the selected value in the input part.

### Styling

The following shadow DOM parts are available for styling:

Part name | Description
----------------|----------------
`toggle-button` | The toggle button

The following state attributes are available for styling:

Attribute    | Description | Part name
-------------|-------------|------------
`opened` | Set when the dropdown menu is open | :host
`invalid` | Set when the element is invalid | :host
`focused` | Set when the element is focused | :host
`focus-ring` | Set when the element is keyboard focused | :host
`readonly` | Set when the dropdown menu is read only | :host

`<vaadin-dropdown-menu>` element sets these custom CSS properties:

Property name | Description | Theme for element
--- | --- | ---
`--vaadin-dropdown-menu-text-field-width` | Width of the menu text field | `vaadin-dropdown-menu-overlay`

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

properties.name: _previousTabIndex
properties.description: Stores the previous value of tabindex attribute of the disabled element

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: Set when the dropdown menu is open

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the `<vaadin-dropdown-menu>`.
Receives arguments `root`, `dropdownMenu`

`root` the `<vaadin-dropdown-menu-overlay>` internal container element

`dropdownMenu` the reference to the dropdown menu element

**NOTE:** The renderer callback can be called multiple times with the previous content.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: The error message to display when the dropdown menu value is invalid

properties.name: label
properties.description: String used for the label element.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
It stores the the `value` property of the selected item, providing the
value for iron-form.
When there’s an item selected, it's the value of that item, otherwise
it's an empty string.
On change or initialization, the component finds the item which matches the
value and displays it.
If no value is provided to the component, it selects the first item without
value or empty value.
Hint: If you do not want to select any item by default, you can either set all
the values of inner vaadin-items, or set the vaadin-dropdown-menu value to
an inexistent value in the items list.

properties.name: required
properties.description: The current required state of the dropdown menu. True if required.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: Set to true if the value is invalid.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description:
A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control.
The placeholder will be displayed in the case that there
is no item selected, or the selected item has an empty
string label, or the selected item has no label and it's
DOM content is empty.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When present, it specifies that the element is read-only.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Moving the focus from the host element causes firing of the blur event what leads to problems in IE.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Native bluring in the host element does nothing because it does not have the focus.
In chrome it works, but not in FF.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Returns true if `value` is valid, and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately.

return.desc: True if the value is valid and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately
